meta.title: Tbilisi Dub Lab - Supporting Reggae, Dub and Roots Culture in Georgia
meta.description: Non-profit community creating an environment where reggae, dub and roots culture in Georgia can grow, connect and sound louder. Dub Fund supporting musicians.

intro.paragraph1: We are non-profit community who are eager to create the environment where reggae, dub and roots culture in Georgia can grow, connect and sound louder.
intro.paragraph2: We have launched a Dub Fund to support musicians. We have a team of producers who help to prepare releases. And we are opened for new residents and partners.

donation.title: donate
donation.description: Dub Fund collects donations. All collected funds go to finance musicians' rehearsals, sound recording and coverage of activities. We report on the foundation's work once a month.
donation.otherDescription: If you want to donate to us in other ways, including cash or cryptocurrencies, write to

contact.title: contact us
contact.description: We are open to any dialogue. If you are a musician, producer, or just someone who wants to collaborate with us, fill out this form and we will get in touch with you.
contact.messagePlaceholder: Tell us about yourself and your ideas...
contact.successMessage: Thank you! Your message has been sent successfully. We will get back to you soon.
contact.errorMessage: Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later.

residents.description: Residents are those whose musical projects and ideas we invest in and support.
residents.callToAction: Want to become a resident? Write to us and we'll discuss your project.

partners.description: Partners are those we collaborate with regularly and create joint projects together.
partners.callToAction: If you have a partnership proposal, write to us.

martokatsi.name: Martokatsi
martokatsi.whoIsHe: Damiane Gordeladze is a Gurian musician and blogger, known in the online space under the name “Martokatsi”.
martokatsi.whatHeDoes:
He began with Gurian folklore in childhood, then studied Georgian folk music and traditional instruments from different countries. He played in the youth band “LURJI IALKANI” (ლურჯი იალქანი), which combined folk and contemporary genres.

Since 2016, together with his brother, he has been creating the folk ensemble “GORDA” (გორდა), performing concerts in Georgia and abroad, and releasing his first solo album. In the same year, the Gordeladze family ensemble was formed.

In 2018, he held his first solo performance in Paris (Petit Bain).

Since 2020, he has been developing the blog and brand “Martokatsi”, and began composing music for films and commercials, engaging in various collaborations and maintaining active media presence.

Since 2023, he has been working on combining reggae music with folk singing.
martokatsi.partnership: Since 2025, he has been a resident of Tbilisi Dub Lab and has started rearranging and performing previously written songs together with the band Nice Rockers.

lashaRukhadze.name: Lasha Rukhadze
lashaRukhadze.whoIsHe: Lasha Rukhadze is a traveling singer-songwriter and street performer from Georgia.
lashaRukhadze.whatHeDoes:
His family emigrated to Greece when he was 10 years old. He studied music composition and filmmaking in Athens, then traveled extensively, performing with musicians, bands, and artists in more than 20 countries.

He is the founder of the reggae–Afro–Balkan band Teeth ’n’ Tongue Jam.

His debut LP, “Share a Vibe”, was mixed and mastered by legendary sound engineer Jim Fox at Lionfox Studio in Washington, D.C.

Lasha has collaborated with numerous roots reggae and world music artists worldwide and has met and shared stages with legendary acts such as Pablo Moses, Groundation, Twinkle Brothers, and Lee “Scratch” Perry across major European venues. Now back in his homeland, he is focused on bringing reggae and world music influences to Georgia and strengthening the roots locally.
lashaRukhadze.partnership: He met the drummer of Nice Rockers while performing at Liberty Square, and for the past two months has been developing new material with the band, aiming to record an original Georgian roots reggae EP and form one of the strongest live reggae bands in Georgia.

niceRockers.name: The Nice Rockers
niceRockers.whoAreThey: The Nice Rockers are a reggae and dub ensemble formed within Tbilisi Dub Lab as a core backing band for collaborative musical projects.
niceRockers.whatTheyDo:
The band serves as a foundational rhythm section for reggae initiatives in Tbilisi. They rehearse regularly, refine classic riddims, and develop tight musical cohesion to be ready for live performances, jam sessions, and experimental collaborations with guest musicians.

Their current lineup includes drums, bass, guitar, and keys. From the very beginning, the project was designed as an open collaborative platform — a stable musical core around which new formations, projects, and live experiments can emerge.
niceRockers.partnership: As the musical backbone of Tbilisi Dub Lab, The Nice Rockers participate in concerts, recording sessions, and residencies with local and international artists. The band provides a reliable live and studio foundation for reggae and dub musicians who engage with the Dub Lab community, helping to cultivate and strengthen the roots reggae scene in Georgia.
